item.text: This bill declares that the memorandum titled "Presidential Memorandum Regarding the Hiring Freeze" published on January 23, 2017, or any other substantially similar memorandum, executive order, or other action by the President to prevent a department or agent of the federal government from filing vacant federal civilian employee positions or creating new such positions, shall have no force or effect with respect to the Department of Veterans Affairs.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.title: To prohibit any hiring freeze from affecting the Department of Veterans Affairs.
To prohibit any hiring freeze from affecting the Department of Veterans Affairs.

item.fullName: Rep. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 13 (Tuesday, January 24, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SCHRADER:H.R. 696.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section VIII of the Constitution[Page H689]
bill.title: To prohibit any hiring freeze from affecting the Department of Veterans Affairs.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
